comments.body: @xvallspl, @lmoneta  : is it really better to have begin and end here? Can't we pass something to iterate on? With range based looping this would not imply any code change in the body of the methods.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +99,103 @@      /// Iterate over a datastructure referenced by a pointer and accumulate on the exising result
      template <class Iterator>
      void Add(const Iterator begin, const Iterator end)
      {
         static_assert(!std::is_same<decltype(*begin), T>::value,
